meanings.definition: In a manner expressing strong disapproval or regret.
meanings.sent1: She shook her head deploringly at the messy room.
meanings.sent2: He sighed deploringly when he saw the broken vase.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked deploringly at the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The teacher gazed deploringly at the failing grades.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds hung deploringly over the ruined crops.

meanings.sent1: Tears welled up deploringly in her eyes.
meanings.sent2: He spoke deploringly of his lost pet.
meanings.sent3: The old man sighed deploringly as he remembered his youth.
meanings.sent4: The mourners gathered deploringly around the casket.
meanings.sent5: The lonely tree stood deploringly in the empty field.

meanings.definition: In a manner that shows disappointment or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She looked deploringly at the litter on the street.
meanings.sent2: He shook his head deploringly at the rude comment.
meanings.sent3: The child pouted deploringly when denied a treat.
meanings.sent4: The audience murmured deploringly at the poor performance.
meanings.sent5: The judge stared deploringly at the guilty defendant.
